definition: myrrh (Commiphora myrrha)/also written 沒藥|没药
tip/end/final stage/latter part/inessential detail/powder/dust/opera role of old man
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

sentences.english: He sprained his foot. The doctor suggests him using myrrh to alleviate the swelling and easing pain.
sentences.chinese: 扭伤了脚，医生建议他用些末药，以便消肿镇痛。

definition: frankincense

dragon's blood (bright red tree resin)
liquorice (Sophora flavescens), with roots used in TCM
myrrh (Commiphora myrrha)
licorice root
snowdrop bush (Styrax officinalis)/gum storax, used in TCM
costus root (medicinal herb)/aucklandia/Saussurea costus/Dolomiaea souliei
chuanxiong rhizome
Styrax officinalis or Styrax benzoin/benzoin resin (used in TCM)/Benzoinum
Ligusticum levisticum (Chinese lovage root)/ligusticum root
(impure) mirabilite, Na2SO4x10H2O (used in TCM)
Achyranthes bidentata (root used in Chinese medicine)
peach kernel, used in Chinese medicine
borneol
the larva of silkworm with batrytis
